product_overview: The Dinner Decider is a web-based interactive bracket-style food tournament application featuring 100+ Australian food items. It enables users to configure tournaments, battle foods in animated knockout rounds, and view the winner's detailed recipe, history, and sensory map insights integrated from Contentful CMS, all within a visually engaging dark-themed UI.
core_goals: Provide an engaging, interactive food tournament experience with bracket-style battles and animations.
Allow users to configure tournament sizes and apply dietary filters to personalize their experience.
Seamlessly fetch and display detailed food data, including recipes, history, and sensory maps via Contentful CMS integration.
Celebrate tournament winners with a visually appealing result screen including confetti animations and dark theme UI.
Ensure smooth and intuitive user navigation across tournament setup, gameplay, and result screens.
key_features: Tournament Setup Screen for selecting tournament size and dietary filters.
Tournament Game Screen presenting bracket-style food battles with animated transitions.
Result Screen showing winner details such as food images, recipes, history, and sensory maps fetched from Contentful CMS.
Dark theme UI applied uniformly with Tailwind CSS and Framer Motion for animations.
Static dataset of 100+ Australian food items with images and metadata integrated with dynamic Contentful content for enriched details.
Contentful CMS integration handling API calls to fetch rich food content dynamically.
React Router based navigation supporting deep linking to food result pages.
user_flow_summary: User selects tournament parameters (size, filters) on the Tournament Setup screen.
User progresses through a bracket-style tournament where foods battle in pairs using animated battle cards.
Upon tournament completion, user is taken to the Result Screen displaying the winner's detailed data fetched live from Contentful.
If Contentful data for a winner is unavailable, fallback UI gracefully handles missing content.
Users can view recipe, history, and sensory data about the winning food.
Dark theme styling and confetti animation enhance the celebratory experience on the result screen.
validation_criteria: All tournaments should support dynamic sizing and dietary filters without errors.
Contentful CMS data for food items must load correctly on the Result Screen with no API failures.
Recipe, History, and Sensory Map sections must appear for foods with Contentful content; fallback content should appear if data is missing.
UI elements must adhere to dark theme styling with appropriate responsiveness and accessibility.
Tournament battles should animate smoothly with no rendering glitches.
Deep linking (e.g., /result/FoodName) must load corresponding winner data correctly and consistently.
Confetti animation triggers only on tournament completion and winner display.
